title: AlignmentObject
name: AlignmentObject
description: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

alignmentType.title: alignmentType
alignmentType.description: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationLevel'.

educationalFramework.title: educationalFramework
educationalFramework.description: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

targetDescription.title: targetDescription
targetDescription.description: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

targetName.title: targetName
targetName.description: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

targetUrl.title: targetUrl
targetUrl.description: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

additionalType.title: additionalType
additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

description.title: description
description.description: A short description of the item.

image.title: image
image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

potentialAction.title: potentialAction
potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

sameAs.title: sameAs
sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.
